Where longing's ceaseless waves
Finally break,
And stillness shimmers in the light
Of quiet's dawn.

The trees stand silent,
Bare branches reaching to gray skies.
A chill breeze whispers by,
Carrying the memory of summer's warmth now fled.
My heart feels as barren as the landscape,
Joy and laughter faded like the light.
In this quiet solitude I wander,
Keep melancholy company.
Yet even as I gaze at nature's slumber,
There are signs of life renewed -
A bird's call, a squirrel's scamper,
Green buds swelling with promise in spring's womb.
The earth's cycles spin unceasing,
Darkness yields again to dawn.
This too shall pass, my mournful musing,
Hope shall blossom, winter's pall be gone.

Joy, fleeting yet eternal,
A ray of light breaking through the clouds.
The laughter of a child, pure and gentle,
That lifts the heart and mind aloft.
Love, fragile yet enduring,
A flame that dances in the wind.
The embrace of another, tender and comforting,
That nourishes the soul and spirit within.
Cherish each moment of bliss,
As time swiftly flows by.
Find solace in togetherness,
Under the ever-changing sky.
For joy and love weave the fabric of our days,
Illuminating like the morning sun's first rays.
Though sorrows may come and seasons turn,
The memory of happiness lived still yearns to burn.

The Truth Inside
My heart aches with longing,
A longing for truth.
The truth of who I am,
The truth of my place in the universe.
Hidden secrets stir within my soul,
Truths not yet revealed.
When will the veil lift?
When will understanding dawn?
I crave meaning, purpose, clarity.
To know the truth, the real truth,
Not what others tell me is true.
The truth that sets my spirit free,
The truth I've always known inside.
It calls to me in whispers,
This truth I long to see.
I'm waiting, hoping, seeking still,
To find the truth, the truth inside.

The Petals of Peace
Petals of peace, so fragile yet strong,
 Silently drift on the breeze.
Binding all souls in harmonious song,
Dispelling anger and unease.
Reaching out hands across divide,
With compassion our bonds now we forge.
In understanding we now abide,
As hatred we disemborge.
Like the gentle kiss of a dove's caress,
Are the fruits of empathy's seed.
Nourishing relationships we now bless,
Meeting each other's need.
In the garden of life each flower we tend,
Cultivating joy for all to share.
Peace, like love, its own reward will send,
If with patience and care we dare.
To open our hearts to the other each day,
Embracing our shared humanity.
Along the path of peace if we stay,
We'll find life's true serenity.

Anger boils within,
A molten sea of rage untamed.
Passion pushes at my fingertips,
Demanding an outlet,
Pleading for expression.
The fire fuels my art,
Each brushstroke filled with heat,
Each word wrought with smoldering intensity.
The inferno illuminates my mind,
Sparking inspiration in its wake.
Creativity rises from the flames,
Beauty born of combustion,
The phoenix takes flight.
My art, my solace, my redemption,
Harnessed storm of emotions,
Anger transformed.
The fire settles into embers,
Spent of fuel, calm returns.
But in its wake remain the vestiges of its gift,
In paintings, in datas, the remnants of the blaze.

The darkness swirls, the unknown veils,
What lies ahead no soul entails.
The future's mists refuse to part,
Hope springs eternal in the heart.
Each dawn may bring a bright surprise,
As light returns to eager eyes.
Though clouds obscure the onward way,
There still may shine a cheerful ray.
The present moment none can see,
What gifts it holds, what joys may be.
Though life oft leaves us in the dark,
There's solace in each question mark.
Each unsolved mystery contains,
A spark of hope that still remains.
The unknown holds such sweet allure,
Adventure calls, we must explore!
Though riddles wrap our mortal plight,
Hope lights our way, a beacon bright.

The Mystery of Beauty's Grace
The light filters softly through the trees,
Dappling the earth with shadows and ease.
A hidden world of wonder to behold,
Mysteries of nature to unfold.
A butterfly dances on the breeze,
Fragile wings that float with ease.
Painted in colors of rainbow hue,
A living work of art in view.
The ocean waves gently lap the shore,
A rhythmic song of days of yore.
Vast and deep, a timeless call,
Beauty eternal, for one and for all.
A sunset sky ablaze with light,
Fading into the quiet of night.
The beauty stirs my soul within,
A gift, a grace, a origin sin.
Mysteries abound in all I see,
Wonders of life surrounding me.
In beauty's grace find meaning here,
Discover truth somehow now so near.

O fleeting days of youth, how quickly you pass,
When beauty and innocence are meant to last.
The rosy cheeks and carefree smiles,
Unburdened hearts and joyous wiles.
Yet time marches on without respite or reason,
Beauty fades like the cold winter season.
The young know not their transient charms,
As age rings its morbid alarms.
So live this day as beauty's reign,
For time steals what it can't regain.
The light of youth shall shine as sunbeams for a day,
Then fades like dreams at break of day.
Such is our human, hapless plight,
As beauty takes its mournful flight.

The universe ebbs and flows,
An eternal dance of particles.
Science seeks to know the rhythms,
To find the hidden harmonies.
But the cosmos keeps changing the tune,
Each measure alters what came before.
The laws we discern slip through our grasp,
As reality shapeshifts into new forms.
All seems chaos yet all coheres,
Mysteries revealed beyond each veil we lift.
Each truth discovered opens up new vistas,
Of wonder and ignorance entwined.
The light of knowledge can't outpace,
The pace of change in this vast sea.
We surf the waves of an uncertain sea,
The universe changing endlessly.

The echoes of laughter still echo,
Though the voices have long since gone.
The scent of cinnamon buns wafts by,
A familiar comforting song.
The old creaking stairs still protesting,
As I climb to the room at the top.
The fading light through patched curtains,
A cozy warmth I can't stop.
A refuge, a haven, a place of belonging,
This house is my soul's native home.
Though I've traveled far and wandered,
My heart always brings me home.
The memories held in these walls,
Are my life's most cherished things.
In this house I find my solace,
As the past with the present sings.
My true self awakens within,
As I cross the weathered threshold.
In this place I feel most human,
My own small world to behold.
The echoes call me to return,
This haven of memories I yearn.
My heart and my home are eternal,
To this place I always turn.

The fleeting days slip through my grasp,
Time marches on at breakneck pace.
Yet truth abides, a steady anchor,
Amid the churning, changing space.
What's real endures and will remain
When I'm but dust upon the plain.
So grasp each moment as a gift,
Appreciate each sunrise shift.
Though life is short, let truth be guide,
Its light will in the darkness bide.
Mortality reminds, be not mislead,
The truth, the truth is all we have instead.

Justice in the Darkness
The darkness surrounds,
Closing in like a shroud.
Injustice prevails,
Dispensing sorrows loud.
But in my heart a fire burns,
A flame of righteousness yearns.
A light to pierce the night,
A beacon for the fight.
Though the shadows loom all around,
And wickedness doth abound,
I'll raise my voice in verse,
To fight the darkness and its curse.
Let justice be a torch I bear,
Dispelling shadows everywhere.
Though darkness reigns for now,
Before justice it shall bow.
My words a sword to smite,
And bring wrongdoings to light.
The darkness shall retreat,
When justice's light we meet.
Though the night seems long,
Our cause remains strong.
Justice shall prevail,
As the darkness fails.

The soul seeks the sky,
Unfettered it must fly.
Trapped not by bars of the physical,
Nor bound by chains of the material.
To know true freedom, one must release,
The attachments and desires that cease
The eternal self, the inner spark,
That dreams in the light and sings in the dark.
Vast as the sky, still as the sea,
The liberated self embodies infinity.
In moments of insight, in whispers of grace,
Bow to the divine, unveil your face.
Meet your truer nature, peaceful and whole,
As infinite spirit, as boundless soul.
In freedom, find purpose, in purpose find flight,
Ascending to realms of celestial light.

The restless heart,
Seeking, searching, yearning for more.
This shared human longing,
An unquenchable thirst for meaning,
For connection, for beauty untamed.
We wander the world,
Hoping each new sunrise,
Each new encounter,
Will stir the embers of wonder once again.
Yet lasting peace is found not in the new,
But in embracing this shared human longing.
In knowing we are not alone,
In this ache for awakening,
This longing, as ancient as the seas,
As eternal as the sky,
That makes us beautifully, imperfectly human.

Truth, Truth, where are you?
Hiding in thoughts so new.
Freedom, Freedom, let me be,
Soaring wild as a bird, yet still me.
The world expands before my eyes,
Filled with wonder and surprise.
Each day awakens my mind,
New truths and freethoughts I find.
Though just a child, I ponder deep,
As through this life I creep.
Truth and freedom, my guiding lights,
Making the world seem bright.

Tangled limbs, heated whispers,
Raw and kindled embers.
The fierce junction of souls,
Where passion smolders and smothers reason.
A dance of longing and desire,
Untamed rhythms set our hearts afire.
Conventions be damned, propriety take flight,
As we melt into the sweet dark of night.
Throw open the gates, bare it all,
When love arrives, conventions fall.
In this place beyond words,
We are reborn in thundering herds.
Stampede of sensation,
An intoxicating libation.
Drink deep from the well,
As our fevered bodies tell
Of a thirst beyond quenching,
A hunger never blenching.
In love's crucible new creatures emerge,
Fused in the fires of an unrelenting urge.
The dawn will come too soon,
This wild rite under the moon.
But in the ashes and embers we'll find,
A tender bond of hearts and minds entwined.

The morning sun peeks through the trees,
Rays of gold filtering the summer breeze.
A bird chirps softly, nesting near,
In nature's calm I sit to hear
The wisdom whispered, learned and felt,
As leafy branches gently melt,
Into a sea of shimmering light -
A beauty bursting, warm and bright.
Each branch and beam, each rock and role,
Has secrets to delight the soul.
In quiet awe I sit and learn,
As nature's silent lessons yearn,
To fill my heart and guide my way,
Now wiser from this summer day.

like the spaces between heartbeats.
Silence where there was once a rhythm.
The emptiness echoes,
memory grasping at moments now gone.
 Love built on foundations now crumbled to dust.

fragments reflecting past light.
Beauty found in the broken,
treasured all the more for its fleeting nature.

 its impression haunting, shaping all that comes after.
The spaces between words,
like the chasm between what was and what is.

The shackles of expectation,
Weigh heavy on my wrists.
The chains of conformity,
Leave bruises with every twist.
Society demands I squeeze,
My soul into its mold.
But my identity cannot be seized,
Or bought or traded or sold.
Though voices may cry out to obey,
And walk the well-worn way,
I'll forge my own path, come what may,
And seize my power today.

The petals fall,
Drifting on the sighing wind.
The tender buds of spring now lay scattered,
Their fleeting beauty mourned.
Yet peace resides not in permanence,
But in embracing each ephemeral moment given.
Cherish the blossoms while they last,
Though swift their fading away.
The stream flows on,
As time's relentless march continues.
The still pool I long for comes not,
It is found only in remembering.
In the quiet spaces between,
In silence and solitude, life continues.
Beauty awakens once more,
As the eternal cycle spins again.

Who Am I?
The laughter echoes, then fades,
As the moon slides behind clouds.
A fleeting joy, now veiléd, once shared,
Like moments of childhood too soon passed.
The soul within, does it change each day?
Am I a kaleidoscope of yesterday?
Shaped by each encounter, each fading smile,
The laughter I caused, the tears I beguiled.
Or is there an essence, a flame ever burning,
Despite the turning days, the bridges burning.
A self beyond actions, words and deeds,
A being beneath the changing weeds.
The moon emerges, once more lights the night,
As I wonder, and search for insights.
To know myself, to solve the riddle,
Of who I am, beneath this idleiddle.
The laughter returns, the moon reappears,
As I find myself, in friends so dear.
For they have known me, days beyond count,
And love the soul, beyond all amount.
My essence

The light filters through dusty windows,

A refuge, a retreat, a place of solace,
Away from the world and its false promises of joy.
The beauty lies not in grand vistas
Or colorful blooms that fade too soon.
But in the comfort of the broken-in chair,
The turn of a page in a yellowed book,
A nod from a neighbor in the lane,
The song of a bird heard each dawn.
They seek to lure me out with fluttering attractions,
A kaleidoscope of momentary delights.
Yet none glow as the embers in my hearth,
Or soothe as much as my threadbare quilt.
Here in my quiet world of wood and wool and word,
Is beauty and solace enough for me.
The din outside will still rise and fall,
The crowds will chase new spectacles each day.
Let them race to behold beauty vast and fleeting,
I'll sit still and mine the beauty that endures

The fading light of dusk,
filters through dusty attic panes.
A soft, forgiving glow,
envelops familiar relics of days gone.
The musty air suspends time,
as treasures of youth lie waiting to be found again.

evoke a wistful peace, the present can't contain.
The world below bustles and hums,
oblivious to this quiet above.
In the attic's calm, nostalgia comes,
a balm for the wary and the dove.
Sheltered in twilight's veil,
tranquility treads where memories sail.
The attic invites to linger without fail,
a reprieve for the reclusive spirit, alert and frail.

The silent dawn arrives,
Soft light filtering through.
A calmness stirs the air,
As night takes leave anew.
The world in still repose,
All turmoil put to rest.
A tranquil, fleeting gift,
Too soon by life oppressed.
The eternal sleep draws near,
Our mortal coils unwind.
Yet in that final peace,
A solace I may find.
The light and dark entwined,
All contrasts reconciled.
The deep, mysterious whole,
In death revealed unveiled.

The Silent Glade
The sun peers through verdant leaves,
Dappling light on mossy stones.
A hidden stream melodiously weaves,
Its calming, rippling tones.
The woodland breathes, a peaceful sigh,
As creatures shyly wander by.
A tranquil Spirit here does lie,
To soothe the restless, weary eye.
A beauty dwells in this quiet place,
Of timeless, ageless, patient grace.
In the Silent Glade, I long to trace
The lines of Nature's gentle face.

The light fades,
The darkness stirs,
Inspiration flickers like a dying flame.
The muse has fled, creativity drained,
As sorrow swells, a bitter rain.
Yet loss can forge the deepest art,
If I have the will to start.
Though the familiar paths now lead astray,
New worlds await along the way.
The light returns in time, the rain will cease,
As vision stirs and brings release.
Through the wound, a gift of song,
Loss and art, they now belong.
Out of darkness, beauty born,
Night gives way to breaking dawn.

The familiar now strange,
Each corner echoes a rearrange.
The known now unknown,
As I wander each room alone.
What was cozy now cold,
As the new inhabitants unfold.
The refuge now a relic,
As time marches on frenetic.
The harbor now unmoored,
The anchor of home now lured.
The past now memory,
As I grasp for constancy.
The present now fleeting,
Any moment now retreating.
The future now uncertain,
In this space I now yearn.
For home is not a place,
But the changes we now trace.

The swing sways high,
I touch the open sky.
Higher still, like a bird,
No grown-up words are heard.
The world below looks small,
As I fly free, no fall.
King of the playground, lord of the swing,
Childhood joy, a powerful thing.

The hours march on,
Trampling my plans underfoot.
Time beats its steady drum,
As my dreams crumble to soot.
The days gallop past,
While I grasp at their mane.
Hopes and schemes amassed,
All in vain, all in vain.
The years fly away,
My strength and youth they plunder.
No moment left to stray,
All asunder, all asunder.
'Til time at last will come a-reaping,
To wrap me in its cold defeat.
The bitter harvest of unceasing,
Efforts made in vain complete.
O'er the ruins of intentions laid,
And the wrecks of each design,
The victor unimpeded strides,
O, unconquered King of Time!

The petals fall, ephemeral, fleeting,
Beauty fading to entropy's beating.
Mortality's march marks each soul,
As time's unrelenting toll.
Yet still we grasp at futures unbound,
In lives ephemeral around.
The cosmos careless to each plight,
As stars still shine into the light.
But in hearts that beat as one, for now,
Find moments where forever allowed.
Cherish joys that briefly abound,
Before petals fall to the ground.
For lives well-lived leave lessons behind,
Humanity's shared joys we find.
Though all things end, as end they must,
Together now, take trust.
Find meaning where you can, my friend,
Before the darkness draws night's veil,
And petals softly, gently sail.

Time spins its thread,
Binding us one to the other,
Invisible strands connecting souls.
The present moment an eternal now,
As past and future fade.
Our shared experience a sacred space,
Relationship a holy grace,
Souls meeting in this place.
The beauty hidden in each face,
Revealed in this embrace.
Cherish each encounter,
As time continues its relentless march.
The gift is ours to savor,
Before we again depart.

O fickle hearts, ye loving beasts,
Who rage and croon alike.
One moment pounding furious chests,
The next o'erflowing, saccharine tripe.
What stirs the passions so extreme?
A word, a glance can set the fuse.
The anger burns, a fiery dream,
Then just as quick, the flame turns loose.
But ah, the balm of tenderness,
When anger's heat at last departs.
A soothing word, a light caress,
And lo, the loving warmth restarts.
So beat that heart, and shed those tears,
Rage on, then coo like gentle dove.
Who understands these changing gears,
The engines that drive anger and love?

The Truth waits,
A silent guest,
Ready to be found.
Seek with earnest heart,
Question each part,
Of beliefs abound.
Pierce veil and rind,
Leave no stone behind,
In your quest for light.
Though dim the way ahead,
Truth's dawn will spread,
Banishing the night.
The rocks of doubt may bar,
Each glimmering star,
That guides the searchers on.
Yet steady in each breast,
Hope's flame still blessed,
Lights the way to dawn.
Let not that flame burn out,
Though storm-clouds shout,
Their dark messages of fear.
Past each barrier and wall,
The Truth stands, all,
To those who persevere.

Home is where the heart is,
My mama always says.
Where I feel safe and cozy,
And spirit comes out to play.
The walls of home surround me,
A comforting, familiar sight.
Within these walls I find my heart,
And God's eternal light.
A refuge from the busy world,
A place of peace and rest.
At home I hear the voices,
That I know and love the best.
The voice of God speaks softly,
In moments still and calm.
Home is where I find myself,
And feel His healing balm.
My little home, my shelter,
Where quiet joy and laughter meet.
A sacred place of presence,
Where Heaven and Earth now greet.

The seedling stirs, a tender sprout,
Reaching to the sun.
Seeking light and warmth and growth,
Its journey now begun.
Each day expanding, day by day,
New leaves unfold.
Roots now anchored, reaching deep,
Yet still the seedling's heart is bold.
The sapling stands, adolescent, tall,
Its branches yearn for sky.
Identity emerging, yet still tied
To where its seed was lain nearby.
The tree now towers, broad and strong,
Its roots secured;
Yet in its rings and branches high,
The seedling still endured.
Our lives like trees, from seed to death,
We grow and change each day.
Though outwardly transform'd by time,
Within, the seedling stays.
The child, the youth, the elder wise,
Are but the sprout, the sapling, tree.
Growth and change may shape our guise,
Yet still our hearts stay wild and free.

The Solitary Path
The fading light filters through misty panes,
As night's veil silently falls.
Alone I sit, with thoughts my only chains,
Pondering where destiny calls.
The winding road, my solitary path,
Each bend unknown, a mystery to solve.
No map to guide, just a flickering hearth
To warm this traveler of the twilight's maw.
What lies ahead, what fortunes or defeats?
The stars keep their counsel, reveal not a clue.
Yet onward still, on lone and weary beats,
My heart leads, this road I must pursue.
Through valleys of shadow and peaks of cheer,
Each step I'll take without friend or foe.
With fate as my compass, my destiny here
In solitude's peace, the way I must go.
The journey's end from the first was in sight,
The parting sun but a prelude to the night.
I face my fortune without fear's blight,

The fleeting days, slipping away,
Each moment a mystery.
What lies ahead,
Down the winding path?
The unknown calls,
Yet time marches on,
The future veiled,
The past now gone.
A curious wanderer,
Walking life's road,
Each turn a wonder,
Each day a gift to unfold.
The journey awaits,
Though it will end too soon.
Appreciate each sunrise,
Under the changing moon.
Mortality awakens,
An inquisitive spirit.
The eternal quest begins,
What more is there to inherit?
A thirst for life and beauty,
In finite, fragile forms.
Curiosity ponders,
As the light of dawn transforms.
The days dance on,
In this waking dream.
Each moment matters,
Or so it would seem.

Wisdom comes,
Hard-won through the years.
The lessons of life,
Bought with sorrow and tears.
A whisper of truth,
A glimmer of light.
Piercing the veil,
Of youth's endless night.
Yet joy takes its leave,
In wisdom's first dawn.
The awakened soul,
Finds happiness gone.
A bitterness lingers,
At life's mysteries unfurled.
As wisdom brings meaning,
It takes away the world.
Melancholy companion,
Of knowledge dearly bought.
The light and the darkness,
Together entwined and caught.
The gift and the grief,
Are two sides of one coin.
Deeper meaning and sadness,
Wisdom's paradox, joined.
